contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God is protecting you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: You are protected by God's power

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God revealed to the prophets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It was revealed to them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the grace that God will bring to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the grace that will be brought to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "For as Moses wrote" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For it is written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has redeemed you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you have been redeemed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the good news that we announced" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the good news that was announced

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that people have rejected" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that has been rejected by people

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that God is building into a spiritual house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that are being built up to be a spiritual house

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for which God also destined them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: for which they were also destined

contextId.information: You can clarify that God is the one who has chosen them. AT: "a people whom God has chosen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a chosen people

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom the king has sent to punish" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who are sent to punish

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you suffer while someone punishes you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you suffer while being punished

contextId.information: Here the word "this" refers to believers enduring while suffering for doing good, as Peter has just described. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has called you to this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it is to this that you were called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has healed you because people bruised him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: By his bruises you have been healed

contextId.information: To "hinder" is to prevent something from happening. This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that nothing will hinder your prayers" or "so that nothing will keep you from praying as you should" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that your prayers will not be hindered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God called you for this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: for this you were called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will bless you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you are blessed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) Christ preached. AT: "Christ preached the gospel" (UDB) or 2) men preached. AT: "men preached the gospel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the gospel was preached

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) God judged them in this life on earth (UDB). AT: "God judged them in their bodies as humans"  or 2) men judged them according to human standards. AT: "men judged them in their bodies as humans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they have been judged in the flesh as humans

contextId.information: Here the word "name" refers to Christ himself. This can be stated in active form. AT: "If people insult you because you believe in Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: If you are insulted for Christ's name

contextId.information: This is a reference to Christ's second coming. This can be stated in active form. AT: "the glory of Christ that God will reveal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the glory that will be revealed
